page.title: 15CROUCH FARM,HIGHWORTH
page.content: There is evidence that Crouch Farm was there when Napoleon was fighting at Waterloo.Today they grow some wheat but the farm is mainly grass.The farm keeps cows and a few horses.They have 180 cows,80 of which are milked.There is one bull and a few geese and chickens.The farm is 300 acres including 10 acres of deciduous woodland.There are twenty fields altogether.The owner of Crouch Farm is The Cooper Essex Trust and the tenant is John Freeman.He is also the Mayor of Highworth and told us that a cow is worth up to Â£500.He employs three people,and the farm has been in the family for twenty five years.
